NACK
I'm against any such hardcoding changes.

One time, it can happen that 0.001 BTC is half a million of dollars. Or half a penny. We should not hardcode such numbers.

@paveljanik I fail to see how my diff makes it any worse.

Still, I agree that the coupling should be done explicitly in the code but on the other hand it seems there is substantial refactoring of the policy code going on right now. So first, I'd like to make sure this is the right direction.
I think the right solution is replacing this variable with one that computes it dynamically from the relay feerate.\n
Coin selection needs a complete rework for 0.14 anyway. Closing for now.\n

I think that using MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE is way too large (it would be around 1 mBTC on my node).\n\nThe choice here is whether to add change, or instead just turn it into fee immediately.
